thread.title: Cash Crunch Clouds Future for Oil Firms
thread.title_full: Cash Crunch Clouds Future for Oil Firms - WSJ

author: Sarah Kent
title: Cash Crunch Clouds Future for Oil Firms
text:
The world’s biggest oil companies are struggling to generate enough cash to cover their spending and dividends, despite efforts to slash billions of dollars from their budgets in the face of tumbling oil prices.
Spending on new projects, share buybacks and dividends at four of the biggest oil companies known as the supermajors—Royal Dutch Shell PLC, BP PLC, Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp.—outstripped cash flow by more than a... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
